that's just on a 3 liter scale, now imagine a 300 liter scale. If you have a large family, 300 liters isn't that much pee. Lets say there's about 1 liter per person per day, now multiply that times lets say 5 people, that's already 5~ liters per day, now lets average out the months in a year so there's 30 days a month (to account for Februarys 28-29 days) now that's 5*30=150 liters a month. In two months you'd already have 300~ liters. Now if you want to go full reclaimer mode, you multiply the 150*12, giving you 1800~ liters a year, and since most of it is water it can be reclaimed and used as non potable water for agriculture, washing, or cleaning use. Basically this process is really only viable (and even then its not very viable) if you absolutely need to reclaim the water and the useful products still left in the pee, like if you were on a spaceship or a Lunar/Martian colony. But you'd probably not use this method and probably a different one that has a more efficient way to separate the different compounds more economically.

Hey brother, I use a 6 Qt. pressure cooker to collect and process the whole thing. Get a fermenter's air trap, place it through the lid and add a funnel. I pee in the funnel, then splash a bit of water to wash the aroma down the trap. It's just like a flush. Then, when full, I put it on the stove on low. The steam vent (the whistle) is a perfect fit for a 5/16" tubing. Vent that shit right out the window with a long piece of hose. No stink, no handling . This is the Old Man's way of minimizing the trauma of science, 😁

Excreted urea in the urine changes by age of the individual.  The laboratory test used is determination of the amount of Nitrogen in a unit volume of urine.  Newborns urea nitrogen is usually around 4 mg per 100 cubic centimeter of urine test.  As a young adult it is around 10 mg%.  If the kidney function deteriorates to higher levels because of diseases affecting the integrity of the kidney function, it then leads to measures higher a d higher than 15mg % or even 25mg %.  Remember that the amount of urine produced on a 24 hour basis also depends on the state of hydration.  We're you well-hydrated on the day you collected ALL f your urine for 24hours?  These specific requirements have to be followed before the results have meaning.  Next time, measure the amount of Nitrogen in your 24-hour collection of you urine.  Better yet, ask your doctor what your Blood Urea Nitrogen Level is. That is cheaper, more accurate of your kidney function.  Pee Happy.  Sorry, I meant to say: Be Happy!

Imagine how people were 5,000 years ago without God’s True Book. How would they have known how they were supposed to live? How would they have known how they were supposed to be in order to please their Creator? So God gave the law of Moses back then. This law was for the people to know how to be. They saw what God expected out of them. God had high expectations from the Israelites. Why shouldn't He? Should He drop His expectations for love and grace? If He drops His expectations to accommodate what man wants, then He compromised His perfection for man’s imperfection. Does a Perfect God compromise His perfection?
So God has expectations once He tells His creation how He wants things. His love and grace gives His creation time to change. He is willing to help them change if they ask Him. Then His creation, while repenting or changing to do His will, see His Beauty. This is a relationship formed now with the Creator. If He is the Most Beautiful Being, which He is, how can His creation not want to obey Him? How can His creation not want to please Him? The reason why is
because of foolishness. Man loves his own foolishness rather than God’s wisdom, Jn 3:19. Man loves his sin. If anyone loves himself, he will stay in sin. So man who stays in sin rejects his perfect Creator or Father, and exchanges it for his own foolishness.
So now fast forward to today where we have God’s True Book. We officially know what God wants. God gave His creation a big help, the Word, to show us how He wants us to live. If we follow His perfect teachings, we all live with perfect peace, love, joy and unity. This is His perfect design for His children's lives. When we go against His perfect design for what we want, sin, we throw away that perfect plan. We throw away that perfect peace, love, joy and unity. Giving up these things is foolish. So sinning against God proves to be the worst plan for us!
God wanted to help mankind. God wanted to save man from his foolishness. He wanted to help us the best way possible because He is Good. The best and only way to do it, as God saw fit, was to give mankind His Son. Why? The Son is the Word, Jn 1:1. The Word always obeys the Father's will. The Father's will is spoken through His Word. That's why Jesus says no man forces Him to lay down His life, He chose to lay it down, Jn 10:18. God wanted to save mankind. Jesus wants what the Father wants. The

Because the Son asked 3 times in the Garden, "Take my cup not by my will but by yours." The Father said the Son still had to shed His blood on the cross. I was thinking about the yield issue and I remembered reading somewhere that the bacteria in your urine breaks down the urea into CO2 and ammonia. If it took 3 days to collect that much at a reduced water intake the amount of urea should have been higher but it was most likely started to be digested. I've had some in a few milk jugs and if it isn't full it will go dark over the course of a month with a film forming on the surface. Keeping the air out seems to keep it a lighter colour. Also a precipitate will drop out after a while. Here in Australia we are enjoying an adblue shortage currently so who knows, we might need our pee.

Was the Jesus of the Bible who He claimed He was? Was
He really God's Son? Was Jesus the Messiah?
There are over 300 prophecies  that point directly to the Messiah. Here is an example of just 8 :
The time of His birth (see the Daniel 8 & 9 Timeline).
He would be born in Bethlehem. (Micah 5:2)
He would be born of a virgin. (Isaiah 7:14)
He would be betrayed for 30 pieces of silver. (Zechariah 11:12)
He would be mocked. (Psalm 22:7,8)
He would be crucified. (John 3:14)
He would be pierced. (Psalms 22:16)
He would die with the wicked, but He would be buried with the rich. (Isaiah 53:9)

Mathematics & Astronomy Professor Peter W. Stoner has made the statement that the
chances of just 8 prophecies (like these) coming true by sheer chance is 1 in 10¹⁷(100,000,000,000,000,000). That would be equivalent to covering the whole state of Texas with silver dollars two feet deep and then expecting a blindfolded man to walk across the state and on the very first try find the ONE coin you marked (roughly equivalent to the Province of Ontario being 1.5 feet deep).
And if we were to add only 8 more similar prophecies, for a total of 16, the odds would be 1 x 10²⁸ x 10¹⁷ or 1 in 10⁴⁵ (1,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000)
Using the same type of illustration as above, if we were to press this many silver dollars(10⁴⁵) into a ball and place the center of this ball where the center of our Sun is, this silver ball's outer edge would be in approximately the same area as the orbit of Neptune (almost to Pluto.). One man fulfilling all 16 prophecies by sheer chance would be like sending a blind-folded person out to find one specific silver dollar that has been marked and has been mixed up somewhere in this huge ball and actually finding it the first time! (Keep in mind that this is a three-dimensional BALL, not a disk like our Solar System.)

Professor Stoner gives us yet another illustration, but this time, because a silver dollar, and even the atom, would be too large for this one he chose to use just the electron that orbits the nucleus of the atom.  The electron is one of the smallest particles of matter known to man. It is so small that if you lined up 2.5 x 10¹⁵ (2,500,000,000,000,000) single file you would end up with a line that is only 1 inch long. (If we were going to count the electrons in this line one inch long, and counted 250 each minute, and if we counted day and night, it would take us 19,000,000 years to count just the one-inch line of electrons.)
Now back to Stoner's illustration. Using only 48 of the prophecies that Jesus fulfilled it was
calculated that the chances of one person fulfilling these by sheer chance would be 1 in 10¹⁵⁷To help us understand how huge this number is he suggested taking 10¹⁵⁷ electrons and pressing them into a solid ball. This ball, made entirely of electrons, would pretty much fill, not just our galaxy, but the entire known universe. (At the time Stoner's book was written the universe was known to be at least 6 billion light years in all directions. Stoner's known universe would need to be filled about 10,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000 times.) If you’re looking to have natural, glowing skin simply just apply New or aged urine on your skin and let it dry. The smell fades away after 30mins and leaves a sweet scent. Aged urine is best for topical use because of the urea and stem cell content being a lot more potent then using less than a week old urine. I use urine as my shampoo/conditioner, for dandruff/dry skin(works great), acne, cuts, and sunburns (works great). There is so much use for urine both aged and new. Works great for just anything. This reminds me of the early days of sex hormone discovery in the 1930s, German pioneering research involving the extraction of an androgenic compound from male urine (androsterone). They collected 200 liters of their urine and boiled it down to a syrup in order to extract it with chloroform. In my opinion, your low urea yeild might be due to the fact that in presence of an enzyme called urease produced by some bacteria naturally present in urine that's left in a jar for some time, urea is decomposed into Ammonia. That also explains why "old" urine has such a foul smell compared to "fresh" one. In order to increase the yeild, you could try to store your urine away from sunlight and in a cold environement, that would slow the urea decomposition process.

I didn't realize that that crystallized gunk was urea! When I was in basic, my bases plumbing went out due to construction and pipe rerouting, but it went out the longest in my barrack. If we had to use the toilet, you got basically 3/4 of a liter of water to "flush" with. We were told not to waste it on urine as the pipes were stationary so it would sink eventually. Well after ~1.5 months, these massive yellow stalactites formed basically everywhere that had an overhang. The stalls of the toilets, under the urinals, even on the sinks/ceiling corners.

There were days where instead of training, after a month and a half, we'd all put on most of our HAZMAT gear (hood, "overalls", gloves) and everyone in the barrack had to clean the toilets for the day.

It was probably 110 most days, we had no window screens, and they were building another barrack next to us so there was like a constant cloud of asbestos. I still never found out if any of that was safe. Anyone who asked/protested got extra PT when we "started back up" the next day. I miss it.

In the body, it generally goes like this during metabolism:
In the stomach:
Proteins -> nutrients + nitrogen rich molecules

In the liver, I think:
Nitrogen rich molecules -> Ammonia

In the liver and/or the kidneys:
Ammonia -> Urea

Also, during the breakdown of ethanol in the liver, alcohol dehydrogenase turns ethanol into ammonia, which is then turned into urea.

One important source of loss of urea occurred in the initial evap, where the solution was hot enough to create biuret. This is evident by the stinkiness of your solution, which is losing ammonia due to the reaction 2 (NH2)2(CO) --> NH3(g) + (NH2)2(NH)(CO)2. Vacuum evap would keep the temperature lower and prevent this. Also, aerobic photophobic bacteria begin to break down the urea in urine almost right away, so use the freshest possible. By the way, your procedure is very similar to one recommended by Naquet in his 1855 book, Principles of chemistry founded on  modern theories. Naquet recommended evap 6:1 if i recall correctly, before adding the nitric acid.

Humans actually preferentially excrete Uric acid.
We lack an enzyme needed for the conversion of uric acid to urea present in most other animals, but there's lots of ways to convert uric acid into urea.

Excess heat can decompose the uric acid if it's heated in contact with air...
Bacteria will ferment uric acid into urea.

Most other animals excrete urea instead, but humans, some primates, and guinea pigs lack the requisite enzyme.
